item.title: Slides for my workshop on Markdown and Git
item.description:
Here are my slides for my Workshop on Markdown and Git (2019-09-16). Note that you need to be online to render the slides (due to heavy use of JS).

The Rmd source code (master file) can be found here.

The PDF version of the slides can be found here.

item.title: How to document a conference talk in citation manager software
item.description: There are several popular citation manager software packages around. I used to work with Mendeley in class, but I stopped using it since it was acquired by El$sevier. Luckily there are good alternatives around, particularly Zotero. Zotero features a Word (MS Word, Libre Word) plugin, which is a must have for many of us. The more technically inclined folks will use Bibtex. Good news is that Zotero syncs it Library to Bibtex. Best of both worlds with Zotero â€“ I recommend using Zotero.
